Android SDK Architecture

The Jibe SDK on Android consists of two components:

  • An Android Service containing the core of the SDK, which runs from handset boot.
  • A SDK Client Library, which provides a simple interface to the SDK features that are supported by the service

The following diagram shows the functional components of the Jibe SDK, some of which are still in development.

The purpose of the SDK Client library is to provide a common interface to the Jibe SDK across platforms, while at the same time making best use of the programming paradigms available on each platform. For example, in the Android SDK, access to data-rich features is provided via the Android Provider interface, as this is easily bound directly to UI Widget components. Intents are used for delivering notifications, such as the arrival of chat messages.
